examples.sentence: と particle - Other uses of と

sections.heading: What is と Conditional?
sections.content:
と expresses natural consequences, automatic results, and habitual actions. It means "when" or "whenever," indicating that Y naturally/automatically happens when X occurs.

春になると、桜が咲く "When spring comes, cherry blossoms bloom" (natural) このボタンを押すと、ドアが開く "When you press this button, the door opens" (automatic) 彼に会うと、いつも話が長い "When I meet him, the conversation is always long" (habitual)

children.heading: Pattern: [Condition] + と + [Natural Result]
children.content:
With verbs: Dictionary form + と

| Verb | + と | Example | | ------ | -------- | ------------ | | 押す | 押すと | 押すと開く | | 行く | 行くと | 行くとある | | 食べる | 食べると | 食べると太る |

With い-adjectives: Remove い + いと

高い → 高いと "When/if it's expensive" 寒い → 寒いと "When it's cold"

With な-adjectives and nouns: + だと

静かだと - When it's quiet 学生だと - When (someone is) a student 雨だと - When it's rain/rainy

children.heading: Natural/automatic consequences
children.content: 水を熱すると、沸騰する "When you heat water, it boils" 右に曲がると、駅がある "When you turn right, there's a station" このスイッチを入れると、電気がつく "When you turn on this switch, the light comes on"

children.heading: Habitual actions
children.content: 朝起きると、コーヒーを飲む "When I wake up in the morning, I drink coffee" 日本に行くと、いつも寿司を食べる "When I go to Japan, I always eat sushi" 彼に会うと、元気になる "When I meet him, I become energetic"

children.heading: General truths
children.content: 春になると、暖かくなる "When spring comes, it gets warm" 練習すると、上手になる "When you practice, you improve" 年を取ると、忘れっぽくなる "When you get old, you become forgetful"

children.heading: Cannot use with commands/requests
children.content: Wrong: 暇だと、手伝って ❌ Right: 暇だったら、手伝って ✓ Or: 暇なら、手伝って ✓ "If you're free, help me" と cannot be followed by commands! Use たら or なら instead

children.heading: Cannot use with volitional expressions
children.content: Wrong: 明日晴れると、行こう ❌ Right: 明日晴れたら、行こう ✓ "If it's sunny tomorrow, let's go" Cannot use with ~よう, ~ましょう, ~たい after と

children.heading: Can use with past tense results
children.content: 家に帰ると、猫が寝ていた "When I got home, the cat was sleeping" ドアを開けると、誰もいなかった "When I opened the door, no one was there" Describes discovery/observation

children.heading: Example 1: Directions
children.content: A: 駅への行き方を教えてください "Please tell me how to get to the station" B: この道をまっすぐ行くと、駅があります "When you go straight on this road, there's the station" A: ありがとうございます "Thank you"

children.heading: Example 2: How Things Work
children.content: A: このボタンは何ですか "What is this button?" B: これを押すと、エアコンがつきます "When you press this, the AC turns on" A: なるほど "I see"

children.heading: Example 3: Habits
children.content: A: 毎朝何してる？ "What do you do every morning?" B: 起きると、すぐシャワーを浴びるよ "When I wake up, I take a shower right away"

children.heading: Mistake 1: Using with commands
children.content: Wrong: 雨が降ると、傘を持って行って ❌ Right: 雨が降ったら、傘を持って行って ✓ "If it rains, take an umbrella" と cannot precede commands!

children.heading: Mistake 2: Using with volitional
children.content: Wrong: 安いと、買おう ❌ Right: 安かったら、買おう ✓ "If it's cheap, let's buy it" Cannot use ~う/~よう after と

children.heading: Mistake 3: Using for one-time hypothetical
children.content: Unnatural: 明日雨が降ると、中止です ⚠️ Natural: 明日雨が降ったら、中止です ✓ "If it rains tomorrow, it's cancelled" と is better for habitual/general, use たら for specific future

children.heading: Past tense discoveries
children.content: ドアを開けると、そこには美しい庭があった "When I opened the door, there was a beautiful garden" 窓から外を見ると、雪が降っていた "When I looked outside from the window, it was snowing" Describes what you discovered/found

children.heading: Natural laws
children.content: 温度が下がると、水は凍る "When temperature drops, water freezes" 地球が回ると、昼と夜ができる "When the Earth rotates, day and night occur" 物を落とすと、下に落ちる "When you drop something, it falls down"

children.heading: と - Natural/habitual
children.content: 春になると、桜が咲く "When spring comes, cherry blossoms bloom" (every year) Automatic, habitual, general truth

children.heading: たら - Hypothetical/specific
children.content: 春になったら、お花見に行こう "When spring comes, let's go cherry blossom viewing" Specific future plan, hypothetical

children.heading: Common with と
children.content: まっすぐ行くと、信号がある "When you go straight, there's a traffic light" その角を曲がると、郵便局が見える "When you turn that corner, you can see the post office" 二つ目の交差点を左に曲がると、学校がある "When you turn left at the second intersection, there's a school"

children.heading: How things work
children.content: ここを押すと、開く "When you press here, it opens" このレバーを引くと、水が出る "When you pull this lever, water comes out" 電源ボタンを長押しすると、電源が切れる "When you press and hold the power button, it turns off"

children.heading: Natural cycles
children.content: 夏になると、暑くなる "When summer comes, it gets hot" 秋になると、葉が落ちる "When autumn comes, leaves fall" 冬になると、雪が降る "When winter comes, it snows"

children.heading: Daily routines
children.content: 夜になると、眠くなる "When night comes, I get sleepy" お酒を飲むと、顔が赤くなる "When I drink alcohol, my face turns red" 辛いものを食べると、汗が出る "When I eat spicy food, I sweat"

children.heading: Automatic results
children.content: 頑張りすぎると、疲れる "When you try too hard, you get tired" 運動すると、お腹が空く "When you exercise, you get hungry" たくさん食べると、太る "When you eat a lot, you gain weight"

children.heading: Natural responses
children.content: 寒いと、震える "When it's cold, I shiver" 怖いと、叫ぶ "When I'm scared, I scream" 嬉しいと、笑顔になる "When I'm happy, I smile"

children.heading: General time
children.content: 12時になると、お昼休みだ "When it becomes 12 o'clock, it's lunch break" 週末になると、人が多い "When it becomes the weekend, there are many people" 夜になると、静かになる "When it becomes night, it gets quiet"

children.heading: Describing sequences
children.content: この道を行くと、公園があって、 その先に駅がある "When you go down this road, there's a park, and beyond that is the station" Describing route or sequence

children.heading: Basic
children.content: このボタンを押すと、音が鳴る "When you press this button, a sound plays" 春になると、花が咲く "When spring comes, flowers bloom" まっすぐ行くと、駅がある "When you go straight, there's a station"

children.heading: Intermediate
children.content: 朝早く起きると、一日が長く感じる "When I wake up early in the morning, the day feels long" この店に来ると、いつも同じものを注文してしまう "When I come to this shop, I always end up ordering the same thing" 彼女に会うと、いつも元気をもらえる "When I meet her, I always receive energy"

children.heading: Advanced
children.content: 経済が悪化すると、失業率が上がり、 社会全体に影響が出る "When the economy worsens, the unemployment rate rises, and it affects society as a whole" このシステムを使うと、作業効率が大幅に向上し、 コスト削減にもつながる "When you use this system, work efficiency improves significantly, and it also leads to cost reduction"

sections.heading: Related Grammar Points
sections.content: たら conditional - Hypothetical/sequential ば conditional - General condition なら conditional - Contextual Conditionals overview - All conditional forms と particle - Other uses of と Natural consequences - Automatic results
